title: Elemental Workshop (location)
redirects: You have all of the elements

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Elemental Workshop is a dungeon that players can progressively explore more of as they complete the Elemental Workshop quest series. It is accessed by opening the odd looking wall, by using battered key, in the building west of the Seers' Village bank with the anvil icon and going down the stairs.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Elemental workshop
This article is about the dungeon. For the quest series, see Quests/Series#Elemental Workshop series.
Elemental Workshop
Released2 June 2004 (Update)
MembersYes
Floors3
LocationSeers' Village
InhabitantsElemental
MusicTwilight, Prime Time
Map
Advanced data
Typedungeon

The Elemental Workshop is a dungeon that players can progressively explore more of as they complete the Elemental Workshop quest series. It is accessed by opening the odd looking wall, by using battered key, in the building west of the Seers' Village bank with the anvil icon and going down the stairs.

Contents

  • 1 First sublevel
    • 1.1 Rocks
  • 2 Second sublevel
  • 3 Third sublevel
    • 3.1 Mind Room
    • 3.2 Body Room
  • 4 Treasure Trails
  • 5 Personalities
  • 6 Quests
  • 7 Music

First sublevel[edit | edit source]

The workshop can be first accessed during the Elemental Workshop I quest.

The 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] is where players can find elemental ore, though mining them will transform the rock into an earth elemental. Once it is killed, a player may mine an elemental ore. A piece of leather can be found in one of the crates.

Another section is a room filled with water elementals. This room plays an important part in both Elemental Workshop I and Elemental Workshop II.

A third room contains air elementals and a giant bellow.

The fourth room contains fire elementals and a furnace. This room is where player can smelt elemental ore and four coal into an elemental metal.

Use an elemental metal on one of the workbenches in the lobby while carrying a hammer to create:

  • An elemental shield, with either a battered or slashed book in the backpack inventory.
  • An elemental helmet, with a beaten book in the backpack inventory after completing the Elemental Workshop II quest.

Rocks[edit | edit source]

Rock MiningQuantity
LevelExp
Elemental2002

  • The air room.

  • The water room.

  • The earth room.

  • The fire room.

Second sublevel[edit | edit source]

The priming chamber.

Accessed during the Elemental Workshop II quest, four (4) pieces of equipment on this floor (crane, press, tank, and wind tunnel) must be repaired. Players can then process elemental metals by superheating them in lava, stamping them in the press, and cooling them in the tank and wind tunnel to make primed bars. See quest guide for details. These are used to eventually develop elemental mind equipment.

A map of the priming chamber.

Third sublevel[edit | edit source]

Accessed during the Elemental Workshop II quest, this floor contains two (2) doors: one with a mind symbol on it, and the other with a body symbol.

Mind Room[edit | edit source]

You can turn a primed elemental metal into a primed mind bar in this room. Simply place any primed elemental metal into the extractor gun. Then, sit in the seat next to it. For the cost of 20 Magic, you have a primed mind bar.

A player can use a primed mind bar on the ground floor[UK]1st floor[US] anvil to create:

  • An elemental mind shield, with either a battered or slashed book in the backpack inventory.
  • An elemental mind helmet, with a beaten book in the backpack inventory.

Body Room[edit | edit source]

This room is not available yet, though it will most likely be accessed in the third part to the Elemental Workshop series.

Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

  • Searching the crate, just west of the air elementals is the solution to a hard cryptic clue: You have all of the elements available to solve this clue. Fortunately you do not have to go as far as to stand in a draft.

Personalities[edit | edit source]

There are no intelligible species in the Elemental Workshop.

Quests[edit | edit source]

The quests below feature heavily in this dungeon:

  • Elemental Workshop I
  • Elemental Workshop II

Music[edit | edit source]

  • Twilight
  • Prime Time

The '''Elemental Workshop''' is a [[dungeons|dungeon]] that players can progressively explore more of as they complete the Elemental Workshop [[quest]] [[series]]. It is accessed by opening the odd looking wall, by using [[battered key]], in the building west of the [[Seers' Village]] [[bank]] with the [[anvil]] icon and going down the stairs.

==First sublevel==
The workshop can be first accessed during the [[Elemental Workshop I]] quest.

The {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} is where players can find [[elemental ore]], though [[mining]] them will transform the rock into an [[earth elemental]]. Once it is killed, a player may mine an elemental ore. A piece of [[leather]] can be found in one of the crates.

Another section is a room filled with [[water elemental]]s. This room plays an important part in both [[Elemental Workshop I]] and [[Elemental Workshop II]].

A third room contains [[air elemental]]s and a giant bellow.

The fourth room contains [[fire elemental]]s and a [[furnace]]. This room is where player can smelt elemental ore and four [[coal]] into an [[elemental metal]].

Use an elemental metal on one of the workbenches in the lobby while carrying a [[hammer]] to create:
*An [[elemental shield]], with either a [[battered book|battered]] or [[slashed book]] in the backpack [[inventory]].
*An [[elemental helmet]], with a [[beaten book]] in the backpack [[inventory]] after completing the Elemental Workshop II quest.

===Rocks===
{{Rocktable
|Elemental=2
}}
<gallery widths="200">
Elemental Workshop air.png|The air room.
Elemental Workshop water.png|The water room.
Elemental Workshop earth.png|The earth room.
Elemental Workshop fire.png|The fire room.
</gallery>

==Second sublevel==
[[File:Elemental Workshop priming chamber.png|thumb|The priming chamber.]]
Accessed during the [[Elemental Workshop II]] quest, four (4) pieces of equipment on this floor (crane, press, tank, and wind tunnel) must be repaired. Players can then process [[elemental metal]]s by superheating them in lava, stamping them in the press, and cooling them in the tank and wind tunnel to make [[primed bar]]s. See quest guide for details. These are used to eventually develop elemental mind equipment.

[[File:Elemental Workshop (location) second floor map.png|thumb|left|A map of the priming chamber.]]
==Third sublevel==
Accessed during the [[Elemental Workshop II]] quest, this floor contains two (2) doors: one with a mind symbol on it, and the other with a body symbol.

===Mind Room===
You can turn a primed elemental metal into a [[primed mind bar]] in this room. Simply place any primed elemental metal into the extractor gun. Then, sit in the seat next to it. For the cost of 20 [[Magic]], you have a primed mind bar.

A player can use a primed mind bar on the {{FloorNumber|uk=0}} anvil to create:

*An elemental [[mind shield]], with either a [[battered book|battered]] or [[slashed book]] in the backpack [[inventory]].
*An elemental [[mind helmet]], with a [[beaten book]] in the backpack [[inventory]].

===Body Room===
This room is not available yet, though it will most likely be accessed in the third part to the Elemental Workshop series.

==Treasure Trails==
*Searching the crate, just west of the [[air elemental]]s is the solution to a hard [[cryptic clue]]: ''You have all of the elements available to solve this clue. Fortunately you do not have to go as far as to stand in a draft.''

==Personalities==
There are no intelligible species in the Elemental Workshop.

==Quests==
The quests below feature heavily in this dungeon:
*[[Elemental Workshop I]]
*[[Elemental Workshop II]]

==Music==
*[[Twilight]]
*[[Prime Time]]
